title: FileNotFoundError("The config.yaml file at %s does not exist." % cfg_path)
body:
OS: Windows 10
DeepLabCut Version: 2.2
Anaconda env used: 3

I am currently running windows with Anoconda 3, running the GPU_DLC environment where I import deeplabcut and launch the GUI. 

The main issue that I am facing is that there is no clear option to export my model to the .pb format that I need to use my model in Bonsai. 

What I have tried is to do to solve this is:

I set the config-path = to the location of the file

 deeplabcut.export_model(cfg_path,  iteration=None, shuffle=1, trainingsetindex=0, snapshotindex=None, TFGPUinference=True, overwrite=False, make_tar=True)

which did not work, so I tried running:

 deeplabcut.export_model(r'C:\Users\gabri\Downloads\Tail\Tail-FirstModel-2021-02-26\config',  iteration=None, shuffle=1, trainingsetindex=0, snapshotindex=None, TFGPUinference=True, overwrite=False, make_tar=True)

to which the terminal responded:

  313         FileNotFoundError("The config.yaml file at %s does not exist." % cfg_path)
    314
--> 315     cfg["project_path"] = os.path.dirname(os.path.realpath(cfg_path))
    316     cfg["iteration"] = iteration if iteration is not None else cfg["iteration"]
    317     cfg["batch_size"] = cfg["batch_size"] if cfg["batch_size"] > 1 else 2

UnboundLocalError: local variable 'cfg' referenced before assignment


I am not sure if this is an error setting the config_path, or if I am missing something. Any help would be greatly appreciated!



**How to Reproduce the problem**

Make a project in the GUI and try to export the model to PB format
